replies.bodyText:
graphQLTypeName is actually the same as the simpleName(), it's just built in a more roundabout way:
String graphQLTypeName = ModelSchema.fromModelClass(model.getClass()).getName()

In ModelSchema.fromModelClass, name is set to modelClass.getSimpleName()
replies.author: richardmcclellan

timeline.bodyText:
Hm. Are there any remaining types we want/need to paginate over, that are not models?
Iterable<String>, <String>, ModelWithMutation<T>, CustomGizmoNotFromCodeGen?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: The reason I changed this from  to  is so we can paginate over ModelWithMetadata, since ModelWithMetadata is not a Model itself.
replies.author: richardmcclellan

replies.bodyText: Maybe it can be PaginatedResult<ModelWithMetadata<T extends Model>>?
replies.author: rjuliano

replies.bodyText:
Maybe it can be PaginatedResult<ModelWithMetadata<T extends Model>>?

That would work for DataStore, but not for API, because API expects a PaginatedResult<? extends Model>.
replies.author: richardmcclellan
rjuliano

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's not really a Model though.  We could create a PaginatedResultItem interface, which is implemented by Model and ModelWithMetadata though.  Not sure if that's really worth it right now, but I'll think about that for my next PR, which is going to get a little deeper into this code.
